composers.name: Tyagaraja
composers.most_known_for: One of the Trinity of Carnatic music. His kritis are renowned for their simple yet profound devotional expression and lyrical beauty. He created many new raagas.

composers.name: Muthuswami Dikshitar
composers.most_known_for: One of the Trinity, noted for his grand, slow-paced compositions (vilamba kala) with Sanskrit lyrics and for embedding the raga's name (raga mudra) in his songs.
composers.theme: Various Hindu deities; Philosophical and devotional

composers.name: Syama Sastri
composers.most_known_for: The oldest of the Trinity, celebrated for his compositions with complex rhythmic structures (tala), emotional depth, and lyrical elegance.
composers.theme: Goddess Kamakshi; Devotion with an appeal of a child to a mother

composers.name: Purandara Dasa
composers.most_known_for: Revered as the 'Pitamaha' (grandfather) of Carnatic music. He codified the initial music lessons and composed thousands of simple devotional songs (padas and geetams).
composers.theme: Lord Vitthala (Krishna); Bhakti and social reform

composers.name: Swathi Thirunal
composers.most_known_for: A royal composer and ruler of Travancore who composed in multiple languages and forms. His works are known for their melodic richness and emotional variety.

composers.name: Papanasam Sivan
composers.most_known_for: A prominent 20th-century composer, often called the 'Tamil Tyagaraja'. He composed thousands of kritis in Tamil for concerts and early films, known for their piety.
composers.theme: Lord Shiva and other deities; Bhakti (devotion)

composers.name: Mysore Vasudevachar
composers.most_known_for: A distinguished musician from the Mysore court. His compositions, mainly in Telugu and Sanskrit, are noted for their structural perfection and melodic grace.

composers.name: Patnam Subramania Iyer
composers.most_known_for: An influential composer who created many varnams and kritis, helping to shape the modern concert format. His compositions have flowing melodies and rhythmic vitality.

composers.name: Gopalakrishna Bharati
composers.most_known_for: Composing the opera 'Nandanar Charitram,' a powerful musical narrative about a devotee's struggle against caste discrimination. His works are rich in social commentary.
composers.theme: Lord Shiva, social justice; Bhakti and Karuna (compassion)

composers.name: Oothukadu Venkata Kavi
composers.most_known_for: A pre-trinity composer celebrated for his compositions on Lord Krishna, especially the Kamakshi Navavarana kritis, and for pioneering many rhythmic and melodic ideas.
composers.theme: Lord Krishna, Goddess Kamakshi; Bhakti and intricate rhythms

composers.name: Sadasiva Brahmendra
composers.most_known_for: An avadhuta saint and philosopher who composed numerous Carnatic kritis with deep Advaita Vedanta philosophical themes. His compositions are known for their lyrical simplicity and philosophical depth.

composers.name: Appayya Dikshitar
composers.most_known_for: A philosopher and scholar of Advaita Vedanta who is also credited with composing foundational Geetams, including the one in Mohanam.

composers.name: Narayana Teertha
composers.most_known_for: Author of the celebrated opera 'Sri Krishna Leela Tarangini', a collection of kritis on the life of Lord Krishna.

composers.name: Arunachala Kavi
composers.most_known_for: Composing the Tamil opera 'Rama Natakam', narrating the story of the Ramayana through keerthanas.

composers.name: Jayachamarajendra Wodeyar
composers.most_known_for: The last Maharaja of Mysore, he was a great patron of music and a prolific composer of over 90 kritis, often with the mudra 'Sri Vidya'.

composers.name: Muthiah Bhagavathar
composers.most_known_for: A versatile composer, musician, and musicologist from the Harikesanallur village. He composed over 400 kritis in various languages and is credited with creating many new ragas.

composers.name: Koteeswara Iyer
composers.most_known_for: A composer who created kritis for all 72 Melakarta ragas, following in the footsteps of Thyagaraja. His compositions use the mudra 'Kavi Kunjara Dasan'.

composers.name: Ponnaiyah Pillai
composers.most_known_for: One of the Tanjore Quartet, who systematized the format of Bharatanatyam and composed many Alaripu, Jatiswarams, and Varnams.

composers.name: N. S. Ramachandran
composers.most_known_for: A musicologist and composer from Kerala, known for his kriti 'Sri Mahaganapathe' in Abhogi.

composers.name: Pacchimiriam Adiyappa
composers.most_known_for: A court musician in Tanjore and the guru of Syama Sastri. He is most famous for composing the iconic Bhairavi raga Varnam 'Viriboni'.

composers.name: Ambujam Krishna
composers.most_known_for: A prolific 20th-century female composer of Carnatic kritis in Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Sanskrit. Her compositions are known for their poetic beauty and devotion.

composers.name: Ramasamy Sivan
composers.most_known_for: A composer and the elder brother of the renowned Papanasam Sivan. He composed several kritis and is known for his work in Begada raga.

composers.name: Periyasaamy Thooran
composers.most_known_for: A 20th-century poet and Carnatic music composer from Tamil Nadu, known for his patriotic and devotional songs.

composers.name: Subbaraya Sastri
composers.most_known_for: The son and disciple of Syama Sastri. He was a gifted composer who created a few, but highly regarded, kritis known for their melodic beauty and complexity.
